data.title: Nice Cozy Restaurant/Bar
data.text:
We have lived in the Shores over 20 years and have never stopped at this corner bar.  For the last for years, it has been the BUTTER RUN SALOON.  To our surprise, it has an extensive menu - including breakfast!  We came in about 1pm and there were a few empty, but suddenly it filled up (this was a Monday).
Hubby had the 1/3 pound cheeseburger and steak fries and a drink for $5.95!! I had the oven-roasted turkey sandwich with lettuce, tomato, cranberry relish on cranberry rye bread - YUM!!

We plan to stop again soon - they even had ESCARGOT on the menu which I heard is excellent and so is the calamari - next time!

Talk about a full-stocked bar - look like everything your heart desires - plus lots of beer choices too.

Lots of old stuff - antiques on ceilings, walls, and cabinets.  Nice!

data.title: Great Corner Bar
data.text: Hard to find a better selection of Spirits anywhere. Beers include many IPA's to old time favorites. When was the last time you had a Schlitz or Blatz. Excellent Bar food..

data.title: Nice experience
data.text: Visited with son and his family who just relocated to St. Clair Shores. Loved the cozy atmosphere, friendly and informative waitress. They had a great selection of adult beverages. Food was good and a very good menu selection.

data.title: Very good experience
data.text: This place is not very big, but they have one of the largest selections of adult beverages we have seen. The staff is very informative and extremely helpful. Our drinks were outstanding, the food was great and the prices were reasonable. The inside has charm that surprises you. We will be back!

data.title: good food and drinks
data.text: The food is very good nice atmosphere we go there quite often.  We have had the breakfast which was very good, also had lunch and dinners there

data.title: Lots of atmosphere
data.text:
Went there for our sons birthday. Very cute, lots of atmosphere. Inside and outside dining.
Food was excellent, nice selections of appetizers, burgers, sandwiches and a very extensive liquor menu, the largest in Michigan.  Service was very efficient also.

data.title: Great Food and Drinks
data.text: Stopped by for Dinner the food was excellent and the Server was very helpful and timly with all are need. Would recommend to anybody to eat here

data.title: Excellent food and service and reasonably priced.
data.text:
The lady that served us was was very friendly, experienced and very well mannered.
We cannot recall her name but in the check is mentioned 19 GiGi K.
We have tasted ,Bud, Labatt and Blue Moon lagers, they were all great.
Food ,House Burgers were delicious and the salad too. A desert made by a trainee as were  told ,called Chocolate Mint Cheesecake was exceptionally good.
We really enjoyed dinner in this Salon as it is called now so it is highly recommended if you are in the area. Good Food and atmosphere and reasonably priced too.

data.title: First Time, Best Time
data.text: Stopped by here based on recommendation from coworkers.  Nicely surprised, good food, great prices and excellent, funny service.  Karen H was our server, and she was the right mix of sassy and funny!!.. made our evening more enjoyable.  Definitely going back, more than just the "standard" bar food on the menu!! Give them a try!

user_location.name: Grosse Pointe Woods, Michigan, United States

data.title: Nice Place
data.text: Food is good.  Prices are reasonable.  Love the nostalgic tables.  Menu is average for a bar/grill.  Choices of gin for my martini was limited, but that is not uncommon.

data.title: Committee Meeting
data.text: Local corner bar has good food, reasonable prices, nice atmosphere and friendly staff. Very cozy inside, especially for our group of 16 to squeeze in.  Lots of fun, especially for local folks.

data.title: Love their chicken quesidias
data.text: So darn good chicken quesidias I can't stand it! Friendly and efficient service. Fun neighborhood bar with great chicken quesidias.

data.title: WOW!!! Prime rib! Mussels! Escargots! And at the 'neighborhood bar' right around the corner!!
data.text: Varied menu, great food, reasonable prices! Love this re-done by new owners old local bar which is always full of those seeking out a good burger and fries, perch, prime rib,...or a place to have a beer and watch a game!!  It didn't take long for the locals to discover it, as evidenced by the number of people who frequent the 'Butter Run' on a regular basis ~ it's a welcome asset to the neighborhood!!!

data.title: Great neighborhood bar.
data.text: Great food & Atmosphere.  Dinner salads are great, so is the Raspberry Vinagrette dressing.  Turkey sandwich on cranberry walnut bread (toasted) & Hawaian on the same are both delicious.

data.title: Fun, comfortable , warm, relaxed. A place to sit for hours and just enjoy the evening in or outside.
data.text: Great atmosphere. Reminds you of Cheers. Great food and drink. The Waitresses are dynamic (especially Gigi). Ownership always around to sit and chat with all patrons. Great patio and just mention a special event you are celebrating and they go the extra yard. Even without that they all want you to relax and enjoy the stay. Really brought the corner of 11 and Harper to life again. Great place to eat and have a drink. Highly suggest to visit.

data.title: Plain corner pub
data.text: This is simply a corner bar...nothing too special. It needs some updating. Shadow box tables look old and dated. Pretty cramped in there. My husband and I have been here many times but the owner has never said a single word to us. The staff changes all the time. Bartenders are not super friendly. The food is average, although the pig roast a few weeks ago was really great. We had the pulled pork and it was fantastic. I love the patio on warm evenings.

data.title: Nice Time
data.text: We had mussels and beer and sat at the bar. The service is slow but we like the mussels and the sauce. I didn't like that they charged us for 2 extra pieces of bread without telling us ahead of time.

data.title: Butter run , is the cheers of the east side
data.text: Neighborhood bar , friendly , clean, great service, a lot of food for the money , great ribs, &da cute story on how they got their name

data.title: Great concept, Unfortunate execution
data.text: I love whiskey, so I was really interested to try this place.  They have 300 bottles in their collection and many of my old favorites.  Unfortunately, it was difficult to get the list (more than 20 minutes), and it took forever to get my selection.  The bar tender and the server both seemed new and had no sense of urgency.  Perhaps, that is why no one in the place was drinking whiskey, despite the impressive list.  Our cocktails were really watery.  My suspicion is that the very long time that it took to get them allowed the ice to melt too much.  It is a nice space, but the decoration is just not quite right.  Nice try, but it is just not great.

data.title: Perfect place to meet your friends for breakfast, lunch or a butter run
data.text:
This pub is named Butter Run Saloon to commemorate an old family tradition started by Grandpa Harden and his boys.  Sent out to the grocery store to pick up some butter, Grandpa suggested they stop for a brew or two at Pat O'Brien's bar in St. Clair Shores.  Pat O'Brien's became Butter Run Saloon and a butter run came to mean stopping by for a drink or two.  

Butter Run boasts more whiskey varieties than any other bar in Michigan.  They have 19 beer selections on tap.  The place is small but cozy with bar seating as well as table and high-top seating.  Butter Run's décor is kitschy and appealing, with memorabilia hanging on walls, tucked in a glass case and decorating glass-topped window-box like table tops.  Lakeview High School yearbooks from previous years lean in a stack on the window sill.  Anyone wanting to part with their yearbook may want to add it to the collection.  

This is a fun place for breakfast or lunch.  The food is good, the prices are competitive and the service is attentive.  Music plays in the background but the sound level easily allows conversations with your table companions.

I tried the Slim Jim special with fries.  It was meatier than the Big Boy standard and quite good.  My friends enjoyed Beef Barley soup, a cheeseburger bacon Club Sandwich and a lite plate, featuring a hamburger patty, cottage cheese and tomatoes.  

Located on the southeast corner of 11 Mile and Harper, Butter Run Saloon is a  regular hangout for my brothers and their friends.  I enjoyed my first visit and  I'm sure we'll be back.  I really like the ambiance.
